alert.note: Alert for Forsyth; Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 31 at 12:29PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity for the following rivers in Georgia... Big Creek near Alpharetta affecting Fulton and Forsyth Counties. For the Big Creek...including Alpharetta...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and forecast. * WHERE...Big Creek near Alpharetta. * WHEN...Until Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 8 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand further into the woodlands and fields along the creek from near Cumming in south Forsyth County to Alpharetta and Roswell in north Fulton County. Additional portions of The Big Creek Greenway have minor flooding with 1 to 2 feet of water. Most of the walking and biking paths will be closed...especially upstream and downstream from the gage on Kimball Bridge Road and near Rock Mill Park. Portions of the YMCA Campground off Preston Ridge Road will flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Friday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EST Friday was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river will be near 7.9 feet or possibly rise a little more this afternoon into evening. It will fall below flood stage Saturday afternoon and to near 6.1 feet Saturday evening and then begin rising early Sunday morning. It will then rise again to 6.3 feet early Sunday morning. It will fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 7 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
